translation: I see You with boundless form on every side, with many arms, stomachs, mouths, and eyes; neither the end nor the middle nor the beginning do I see, O Lord of the Universe, O Cosmic Form.
commentary: 11.16 many arms, stomach, mouth and eyes with manifold arms? stomachs? mouths and eyes? I see (I) see? You Thee? Everywhere on every side? Infinite form of boundless form? Not not? Anatm end? Not not? middle middle? Not not? Again,again? Your Thy? Adim origin? I see (I) see? Visvesvara O Lord of the universe? Visvaroopa O Cosmic Form.Commentary A thing that is limited by space and time has a beginning? a middle and an
